heading: 2.7.3 Description
text: Northeast Fisheries Science Center (NEFSC) Bottom Trawl Survey (BTS) primary source synoptic, shelf-wide, multiseason, annually repeated fish oceanographic data Northeast U.S. Shelf. Furthermore, primary data source relative abundance data 48 stock assessments (important component additional 6 assessments), well source population demography, maturity, stomach contents data region. also reliable source biological samples, requested, internal external partners. objectives NEFSC BTS twofold: (1) monitor trends biological parameters (e.g., recruitment, biomass, growth, maturity, mortality) geographic distribution fish invertebrates Northwest Atlantic Continental Shelf; (2) collect monitor ecosystem-level data broad-scale oceanographic environmental changes. BTS fully standardized, including sampling gear construction performance, vessel(s), standard operating procedures, spatiotemporal sampling consistency. Survey catch identified species level fish subset invertebrates (.e. decapods, cephalopods, bivalves), aggregate catch weights recorded species. Biological samples individual weights collected subsampled fish, subsampled invertebrates, protected species. gear captures smaller size classes commercial gears, therefore provides estimates cohorts enter fishery, well critical samples immature fish inform maturity curves. Oceanographic sampling includes vertical conductivity, temperature, depth (CTD) cast trawl stations, oblique bongo plankton tows subset stations, continuous measurement additional variables via surface water flow-system.

heading: 2.10.3 Description
text: principal objective Ecosystem Monitoring (EcoMon) program assess hydrographic, planktonic pelagic components Northeast U.S. Continental Shelf Ecosystem. Ecosystem Monitoring surveys contribute stock assessments, protected species assessments, ecosystem assessments. EcoMon surveys sample continental shelf 2 – 4 times per year. Plankton samples also collected Northeast Fisheries Science Center spring fall bottom trawl surveys.

heading: 2.10.6.1 SMIT_ECOMON_STATIONS
text: DescriptionThere thirty-five Ecosystem Monitoring fixed hydrographic sampling stations across Northeast Shelf ecosystem. Four transects run inshore continental shelf north Cape Hatteras Cape Cod. One transect bisects Gulf Maine coast Maine across Georges Bank. remaining twelve stations Gulf Maine sample deep basins, banks, coastal areas, inflow (Northeast Channel) flow (Great South Channel) gulf.

Thirty randomly selected stations targeted sampling region survey.

heading: 2.15.1 Naming convention for spatial tables in oracle database
text:
NEFSC scientific survey strata compiled oracle database MDEB_SPATIAL schema. spatial tables projected North American Datum 1983 (NAD 83). NEFSC scientific survey strata naming conventions follows:      SCHEMA.PROJECTABBR_SURVEYCODE_STRATA
example, Bottom Trawl Survey strata:
      MDEB_SPATIAL.SMIT_BTS_STRATA
Surveys associated substrata named follows:
      SCHEMA.SMIT_SURVEYCODE_SUBSTRATA
Surveys associated historical strata named follows:
      SCHEMA.SMIT_SURVEYCODE_STRATA_HISTORIC
Surveys associated point layer (ex. sample stations) named follows:
      SCHEMA.SMIT_SURVEYCODE_STATIONS
Surveys associated line layer (ex. surveylines) named follows:
      SCHEMA.SMIT_SURVEYCODE_LINES
three tables containing metadata associated survey strata. named follows:SCHEMA.SMIT_META_FEATURES contains information survey strata feature services.SCHEMA.SMIT_META_FIELDS contains information fields, including aliases fields descriptions.SCHEMA.SMIT_META_LAYERS contains information layers within feature services.

heading: 4 Connecting R and AGOL
text: connect R ArcGIS Online (AGOL) need use ESRI’s R-ArcGIS Bridge, collection R packages integrates R ArcGIS. easiest way install R-ArcGIS Bridge install arcgis metapackage,recommended newest version R installed, minimum R version 4.3 higher.installed arcgis can load packages using,load:arcgisutilsarcgislayersarcgisgeocodearcgisplacesThe rest tutorial show 1) find feature layer url MDEB GIS Data Hub 2) read data feature layer.

heading: 4.1 Find a feature layer url
text: Navigate MDEB GIS Data Hub.Find survey ’re interested using Content library Content gallery. tutorial, use Content library focus Ecosystem Monitoring Survey (EcoMon). EcoMon’s page, scroll want ... section click View Data Source link.find Explore page instead, don’t worry. can navigate page clicking View Full Details button.click View Data Source link, brought feature service page.Copy url address bar store R object, url remote resource (feature service) need next section tutorial.
code:
## url for EcoMon Strata feature layer
ecomon_url <- 'https://services2.arcgis.com/C8EMgrsFcRFL6LrL/arcgis/rest/services/Ecosystem_Monitoring_Survey/FeatureServer/1'

heading: 4.2 Read in data from a feature layer
text: Now use arc_read() function extract data EcoMon Strata feature layer store results R object called ecomon_strata.can also use SQL clauses limit number rows returned hosted feature layer, especially need subset data. can efficient, reading subset data memory faster less costly, relative reading entire dataset (don’t need entire dataset).can also select subset columns fields return feature layer, just populate fields argument arc_read() function.
code:
## Download EcoMon Survey strata from the MDEB GIS Data Hub
ecomon_strata <- arc_read(url = ecomon_url)
ecomon_strata
